title: Tools: GCC ARM Exporter - Nordic targets - softdevice hex file path is set statically
body:
The GCC ARM makefile template for NRF51 targets have path statically set which is functional only with mbed library. A code snippet from the tempalt makefile for NRF51822 target: 
SOFTDEVICE = mbed/TARGET_NRF51822/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_MCU_NRF51822/Lib/s110_nrf51822_7_0_0/s110_nrf51822_7.0.0_softdevice.hex
This should be dynamically set or at least to distinguish between mbed lib/mbed sources.

title: FRDM-K64F Bootup issue when powered from K64F USB port requires NMI handling
body:
Refer to https://community.freescale.com/message/443763?et=watches.email.thread.
Summarized, it says that NMI can be called at bootup and lock the processor.
Handling the NMI in the way presented in the ticket should fix it, although an
hardware fix might eventually be introduced.

title: [MAKE.py] additional error handling when missing an option in private_setttings.py
body:
Adding an error handling.

make.py with the option -n PROGRAM_NAME wants to have a test_alias
variable in private_settings.py. Without this alias and with a wrong
PROGRAM_NAME an error message is generated because of a missing else
branch.

title: [private_settings.py] and [setup.py]
body:
1.
Calling setup.py creates a private_settings.py with one line:
from mbed_settings import *

But this line can't be executed so that several tools prints an error mesage. Only when mbed_settings.py exists everything is OK. But mbed_settings.py is nowhere documented and does not exists per default.

2.
make.py with the option -n PROGRAM_NAME wants to have an test_alias variable in private_settings.py. Without this alias and with a wrong PROGRAM_NAME an error message is generated because of a missing else branch.

Perhaps setup.py can be changed that a correct private_settings.py with a default test_alias is generated? Or a default test_alias will be defined in settings.py and the other scripts are changed that the test_alias is not imported from private_settings.py but from settings.py similar to all the other fields.

But changing/deleting the import line in a new generated private_settings.py is obligatory.

title: [export] Add no rtti flag to exporters

Libraries that inherit from SDK objects and not built with this flag will fail during offline compilation. Started with LPC11U24 and ends up being a good thing to do for all

title: [API] Timer-start behavior (bug)fix
body:
Only start the timer when it is not running currently. In old behavior
the current slice-time was discarded, now multiple starts have no
effect.

The total time of a timer consists of two parts: The current time, and the stored time from the last time stop() was called. Right now the start command sets the starting point of now running time to the current time. This means if you call start twice, effectively the last one overrides the first one. However the stored time from the last stop() command does stay correct. Effectively this means that the current time is reset, but the stored time is not. To me this looks like unintended behavior, and if a timer is already running and the start function is used, it should just continue running.

body: Currently the MAC for K64 is hardcoded and causes conflicts when multiple devices are on the same network. Seems like mbed_mac_address should be weakly defined for all SDK ports rather than in the mbed_common

title: [NUCLEO_F030R8] port HAL to support cube and add cube files as well
Retarget STDIO to other than UART_2 without the need to patch the mbed source code
body:
I have added ifndef directives to be able to override the default STDIO_UART\* macro values at build time. This enables overrides without the need to patch the mbed source code (after this pull request is accepted).

I need such an override to retarget STDIO to other than the default UART_2 device, when using STM32F4-Discovery with STM32F4-BaseBoard. The latter has the RS-232 interface routed to the UART_6 device.

I provide a [project example](https://github.com/istarc/stm32/tree/master/examples/BaseBoardUART.mbed-RetargetSTDIO) with an appropriate [Makefile](https://github.com/istarc/stm32/blob/master/examples/BaseBoardUART.mbed-RetargetSTDIO/Makefile) (see DEFS variable) to demonstrate this pull request, 

This pull request updates only the STM32F407VG code. Other targets may need this update as well.

title: [DISC_F407VG & ARCH_MAX] change default toolchain & use different PeriheralNames.h files
USBDevice  Fails to build on the F411RE
body:
As of 6th October 2014, Mbed's USBDevice library  fails to build on the Nucleo_F411RE. Reports the following errors for  pins PA_8, PA_9, PA_10, PA_11 & PA_12.:
- Error: Too few arguments in invocation of macro "STM_PIN_DATA" in "USBDevice/USBDevice/USBHAL_STM32F4.cpp", Line: 58, Col: 42
- Error: Expected an expression in "USBDevice/USBDevice/USBHAL_STM32F4.cpp", Line: 58, Col: 24

I also get two warnings:
-Warning: Integer operation result is out of range in "USBDevice/USBDevice/USBHAL_STM32F4.cpp", Line: 230, Col: 50
-Warning: Integer operation result is out of range in "USBDevice/USBDevice/USBHAL_STM32F4.cpp", Line: 256, Col: 49

These errors occur when building the USBMouse example in the online compiler. Same errors occur when building the USBDevice library for the Nucleo_F411RE using the offline Python build system.

only TX or RX is a valid use case, this should be handled.

who adds asserts there may also fix it in all other code).

title: [EXPORT] commandline options for export_test.py similar to build.py
body:
This is a suggestion to use the tool export_test.py in a similar way like e.g. build.py. The reason to change the behaviour was the development of an gcc_arm toolchain/exporter for Nucleo_F334. The hal of this board currently does not allow to link with the rtos library. Both define a SysTick_Handler. 
With command line options, similar to build.py, the export can be limited now to specific toolchains, targets and/or export projects.
Without a command line option the behaviour is the same as before.

Here are the options:

Usage: export_test.py [options]

Options:
-h, --help            show this help message and exit
-a, --all             export all projects and MCU to all toolchains
-m MCU, --mcu=MCU
     export for the given MCU (ARCH_PRO, DISCO_F051R8, ... STM32F407)
-t TOOLCHAIN, --tool=TOOLCHAIN
     export to the given TOOLCHAIN (codesourcery, coide, ... uvision)
-p PROJECT, --project=PROJECT
     export the given PROJECT (MBED_BLINKY, RTOS_MBED_BASIC)

title: [EXPORT] EmBlocks EIX plugin support
body:
The plugin is available at:

http://www.emblocks.org/downloads/EIXplugin.7z

Copy the content inside an EmBlocks 2.20 installation. You can drag&drop Mbed generated EIX files into EB or use the Import... file menu.

This version is tested on all the projects from the export_test. The Cpp options are set by the Mbed script on file level so that it will give warning free builds. In the final version this can by overruled so that file level options are not allowed.

The STM32 targets are also tested inside the debugger.

title: Fix opendir for multiple FAT volumes
body: This fixes a bug which exhibits itself if you have multiple FAT volumes mounted. Whereas open() takes the volumes into account opendir() did not.

title: Some CoIDE project file exporter issues.
body:
Hi,

I investigated the CoIDE project files quite intensively in the past by changing options by hand and removing them to see how it effected the loaded project when I was writing the CoIDE project importer for EmBlocks. I found some strange inconsistencies like some have default '0' and others '1' if the particular option was omitted in the file.  

If I load the project generated by the off line tools of MBed e.g. export_coide_NUCLEO_F401RE.zip in EB with the CoIDE loader I have the following issues:
- The UseMemoryLayout is set '0' instead of '1' so it will use the linker script reference rather than generating a new linker file from the memory layout in the project file. 
  Remark: That UseMemoryLayout has a default value of '1' so if it is not mentioned in the project file it is true ("1").
- The linker script is set to path="None",  as far as I know CoIDE has an empty path ("") instead of "None". This shouldn't be a real problem if the UseMemoryLayout is set to '1' but technical speaking is a linker script file "None" valid as far as I know. ( ".ld" extension is not mandatory).  
- The mbed_error.h is referenced but that whole Mbed directory is empty.

it from USBDevice.  Calling readStart twice can cause data corruption if a packet arrives in between the two calls.

Tested on KL25Z.

title: [NUCLEOs] Fix issue with InterruptIn edges disable (MBED_A7 test)
FATFileSystem/USBMSD extra count argument
body:
Since this pull request: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/commit/083ac31ad5aaa324eea114d7c9746e12d3331db0#diff-f7c89e100a1282e511c0020e04b4311bL61, an extra count argument is added to FATFileSystem and USBMSD virtual functions.

First of all USBMSD: I have no idea why it is added, outside of consistency reasons, since it is hardcoded to '1'. On FATFileSystem I think it was added for a custom SDFileSystem library. 

The problem: This breaks every single library which uses either USBMSD or FATFileSystem. Including the official USBMSD on an SD card example, but of course also many user libraries. So my issue/question/remark is: Was it really worth it to break quite some libs for one user lib, which also could have forked FATFileSystem. I do see the advantages of the changes, but I wonder if the disadvantages were known when this was accepted.

I don't know if (partially) reverting these changes should be done, but it is an issue that it breaks alot.

title: Serial getc hangs on STM32L053 target
[HAL][KSDK] Use PIT timer for ticker/timeout
body:
Previously in the KLXX devices the LPTMR was used for ticker/timeout,
since they only have 2 PIT channels which are required for regular
timer. The KSDK targets have 4 PIT channels, which allows for two 32-bit
timers running at 1 MHz.

Since PIT timers are 32-bit, and LPTMR 16-bit, this both simplifies it
and makes it more efficient. It does cost the remaining 2 PIT channels,
but on the other hand leaves the LPTMR free.

title: Remove unused files
body:
These files don't appear to used by any SDK dependencies. From what I can tell sw_timer.c was just left over from /utilities in a previous version of KSDK. The 1.0.0 release doesn't provide this file.

fsl_interrupt_manager.c expects KSDK specific startup.c and linker script to be used which we don't. This is implemented differently in the mbed SDK

Previous tests past because the tests are ran linking against the release archive and not building the mbed SDK from source.

You can reproduce the online build failures by running:
python project.py -m K64F -p 25 -i uvision or python project.py -m K22F -p 25 -i uvision (once added) offline.

- projects can be compiled, downloaded and debugged with CoIDE 1.7.7
- STM32F411xx is not yet supported directly by CoIDE
- STM32F401RE it not supported but STM32F401RB is (only different flash size)
- but the generated project files for the Nucleo boards contain correct flash and ram sizes and that seems to be enough

title: [NET] K64F - enet driver addition (latest merge removed that file)
body: This should fix linker errors reported by net tests.

title: test [MBED_A7] extension
body: The test MBED_A7 is missing one functionality. It tests switch on an edge detection, change the detected edge and switching on both. The complete switch off is not tested.

title: [NUCLEO_F302R8] Migration to STM32Cube driver.
body: Actual code is based on the Standard Peripherals Library.

title: [NUCLEO_F4x1RE] test MBED_A7 InterruptIn failed
body:
The test failed because it was not possible to switch off an already active edge detection. The 2nd part of the test tries to switch of falling edge detection and activates raising edge detection. This failed and both edged detection were active.

The reason is the GPIO HAL module driver function HAL_GPIO_Init. The function changes only interrupt or event flags when the EXTI_MODE flag in GPIO_Init->Mode is set. gpio_irq_set changed the event mode to EDGE_NONE in gpio_irq_t structure but that doesn't influenced the interrupt and event flags in the CMSIS function because of the missing EXTI_MODE flag.

Now gpio_irq_set is able to switch off a specific or both edge detections.

The MBED_A7 test was extended by another part to check if switch off edge detection is OK.

title: Extended #476, which does not break ethernet for K64F
body:
Diff from #476:
- Merged with the latest mbed master - few conflicts resolved manually (MCU_K64F folder for example)
- Enet driver + osa + os abstraction layer + phy driver - reverted to previous KSDK version (commit cfd2a98 for future reference)

The reverted enet will be reverted back once lwip arch sources for K64F gets update to the KSDK 1.0 enet driver. There are couple of warnings present, which will be resolved by an update of enet drivers.

I'll close Erik's request #476 , as this is an extension with resolving conflicts. Thanks Erik for helping out!

...ext.h

These will help me chain BLE callbacks with take some context.

title: [NUCLEO_F4x1RE] export to GCC_ARM
body: NUCLEO_401RE and NUCLEO_411RE can be exported to GCC_ARM

title: [mbed][k64f][enet] Remove extern from c++ guard at closing squiggle
Updated PinNames.h
retarget consoleOutput to be a WEAK symbol; this allows applications to ...
body: ...override it if needed

title: LPC4330_M4 Fix I2C0 Init
body: Correct pin init for I2C0 port. Since I2C0 uses dedicated pins, pinmap_pinout() should not be used as on I2C1.

title: [nrf51822] avoid using a global variable and fix I2C read sequence
body:
- replace global variable - `addrSet`  with struct variable - `address_set`
- I2C read sequence enables suspend task to prevent a received byte to be overridden
- properly generate stop condition of I2C read sequence. Originally, stop condition may delay a few clocks, extra bytes will be read. When using sensors like MPU6050, it is an issue.

title: IAR template file - files, targets and other missing information
body:
The selected device in the project is LPC1768 instead of STM32F401RE.

This problem is not only for the F401RE but for any other devices. The IAR template must be re-written.

title: [LPC4337] add support
[Nucleo_F4x1]: 2 extensions for a) toolchain ARM_GCC and b) test DigitalIn DigitalOut
body:
- adds the toolchain ARM_GCC for Nucleo_F411RE:
  basis for extension are linker and startup script of F401RE with changes in RAM size and isr vector table
- changes the test: DigitalIn DigitalOut for Nucleo_F401RE and Nucleo_411RE boards

title: [LPC4088] Corrected calculation of CAN clock and making it possible to put code in QSPI flash
body:
- Bugfix: The CAN clock wasn't calculated correctly
- Modified the scatter file to allow executable code to be put in QSPI flash. Code must be explicitly marked using for example `#pragma arm section code="SPIFI_MEM"`

title: [nRF51822] Fixed support for Nordic parts with 16k RAM
[workspace_tools] Support for building custom projects
body:
I'm not sure whether this goes against the intentions of workspace_tools, but I think it would be useful if workspace_tools could be used to build generic mbed based projects, as well as the tests which are already available. This could be using a json file or some other kind of configuration file inside a directory representing a project, which defines things like toolchain, target etc. Then, all the user would have to do would be to call `python -m workspace_tools.build_project` or something similar to that, which would then build the project.
I would be happy to implement this myself and submit a pull request, since I think it would be useful for a project of mine, however I wanted to check with @PrzemekWirkus in particular that this functionality does not yet exist.

title: [NUCLEO_L152RE] Enable HSI clock for ADC
body: The HSI clock is disabled when the target starts with the HSE (external xtal or MCO from ST-link).

title: Add derivative support to K64F and updates for MTS_GAMBIT
body: Commit 14b6329 was reverted with merge 5e9f9c0 since the patch was implemented differently rather than accepted and my master was out of sync with your master

title: Update KSDK hal to 1.0 for K64
body:
Merged an older update of Martin with current mbed branch and the latest KSDK 1.0 files. Also prepares for K22 support. And it won't automatically merge so good luck with that :).

Mbed blinky verified to still work, but couldn't hurt to verify also stuff like ethernet still works (which I cannot do).

title: STMs: Microlib heap fix for new, malloc and friends
body:
heap can grow outside 0x400 default size and does not overlap stack area.
I checked on F401 board, the only one i've actually, but isue should be reflected to all other stm32 whith arm micro toolchain.
I really don't know about rtos, i never used so far, i just looked at src and seems it uses new for creating thread stacks, so probably it could fix something there also....or break it:)

title: [nRF51822] conflict - the app timer used by mbed-src library is also used by nRF51822 library
body:
The app timer based on RTC is used by
https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/libraries/mbed/targets/hal/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_MCU_NRF51822/us_ticker.c
and
http://mbed.org/teams/Nordic-Semiconductor/code/nRF51822/file/9689ec201907/btle/btle.cpp

And mbed-src libraries includes app_timer.c, nRF51822 library includes app_timer.cpp. The two are also the same and will cause multiple symbols  compile error.

title: mbed-rtos on CM0 fails to build with "build.py -r -o debug-info"
body:
I'm currently doing offline development with the mbed SDK, and noticed it fails to build under certain condition with a following error:

```
# python build.py -t GCC_ARM -m LPC1114 -o debug-info -r
...
Building library RTX (LPC1114, GCC_ARM)
Compile: rt_CMSIS.c
[Error] rt_CMSIS.c@588: In function 'osKernelInitialize': r7 cannot be used in asm here
c:\src\mbed\libraries\rtos\rtx\rt_CMSIS.c: In function 'osKernelInitialize':
c:\src\mbed\libraries\rtos\rtx\rt_CMSIS.c:588:1: error: r7 cannot be used in asm here
 }
 ^
```

Culpit is the following code in rt_CMSIS.c:

``` c
#if (defined (__CORTEX_M0)) || defined (__CORTEX_M0PLUS)
#define SVC_Call(f)                                                            \
  __asm volatile                                                                 \
  (                                                                            \
    "ldr r7,="#f"\n\t"                                                         \
    "mov r12,r7\n\t"                                                           \
    "svc 0"                                                                    \
    :               "=r" (__r0), "=r" (__r1), "=r" (__r2), "=r" (__r3)         \
    :                "r" (__r0),  "r" (__r1),  "r" (__r2),  "r" (__r3)         \
    : "r7", "r12", "lr", "cc"                                                  \
  );
#else
...
```

Cortex-M0 LDR has a limitation that it cannot directly load value into upper register (r12), and that's why r7 is being used as a temporary register. However, that breaks GCC on debug build since GCC is also using r7 as frame pointer.

I posted a patch as well as a pull request here -> https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/472
